main event: A bright object was sighted moving across the horizon at high velocity near Parkersburg, W.Va. on 6 October 1957.
interesting points: The sighting lasted approximately 30 seconds., The object was observed moving from northwest to southeast., The object was reported by a military pilot on a refueling mission., The object was moving at very high velocity and disappeared quickly., Multiple conclusions were drawn regarding the object, including possibilities of it being a satellite, aircraft, astronomical phenomenon, or possibly manmade.
witness description: a military pilot on a refueling mission
